qas.question: Who began studying the rock formations of the Alps
When did the studying of rock formations begin in the Alps?
What was used in the mid-19th century to explain the presence of "folded" mountain chains?
What theory was more widely accepted by the mid-20th century?

context: Important geological concepts were established as <a0_0>naturalists<a0_0/> began studying the rock formations of the Alps in <a1_0>the 18th century<a1_0/>. In the mid-19th century the now defunct <a2_0>theory of geosynclines<a2_0/> was used to explain the presence of "folded" mountain chains but by the mid-20th century <a3_0>the theory of plate tectonics<a3_0/> became widely accepted.
